question_sentence: Since a condo collapsed in Florida last week, red flags about the building have surfaced. Which statement isn’t true?
choices: The condo was past due its 50-year recertification.
The land it sat on was sinking.
A 2018 report noted a “major error” in the building’s design.
Engineers found “abundant cracking” in the garage.

question_sentence: Which two vaccines may protect people from COVID-19 for years, according to a study published in the journal Nature?
What was the probability of the heat dome that hit the Pacific Northwest this week, according to Jeff Berardelli, a CBS News meteorologist?
An engineer set the Guiness World record for the tallest stack of M&M’s with how many pieces on top of each other?
Which region has surpassed Los Angeles for having the worst traffic in the U.S.?
James Corden announced he will adjust which segment of his talk show in response to insensitivity backlash?
JuVaughn Harrison qualified to be the first American man since 1912 to compete in which two events at the same Olympics games?
How many members of the U.S. Olympics gymnastics team qualified for their first summer games this week?
Which is, or was, the worst day to hit the road this July 4th weekend, according to experts?
What is this?
choices: A Tesla craft designed to be driven on Mars.
A prototype flying car that just completed a test flight.
The first car that can be ordered on Amazon.com.
A car custom-ordered by Chris Paul to celebrate the Phoenix Suns' NBA finals berth.

question_sentence: What is the name of the government aide whose affair with Matt Hancock triggered his resignation as health secretary?
A new Princess Diana statue unveiled on what would have been her 60th birthday is located in the gardens of which royal property?
Which Labour Party candidate narrowly won this week’s by-election in Batley and Spen?
A string of Australian cities have reimposed lockdowns this week as the country reports a rise in cases of which Covid variant?
Who is the author of the soon-to-be-published expose Landslide: The Final Days of the Trump Presidency?
Priti Patel had reportedly had talks with which other European country about sharing an asylum processing facility in Africa?
What was the previous cabinet post held by newly appointed Health Secretary Sajid Javid?
choices: Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport
Secretary of State for Housing, Communities and Local Government

question_sentence: EU leaders have reportedly confronted the prime minister of which member state over newly passed anti-LGBTQ+ legislation?
New research shows the mix of extreme heat and humidity in which Pakistani city makes it one of two places on Earth to have officially passed a threshold hotter than the human body can withstand?
Downing Street is reportedly planning to begin rolling out Covid vaccine booster shots for the highest risk groups from when?
A grand jury in Manhattan has leveled criminal charges against what entity or person close to former President Donald Trump?
choices: The Trump Organization, his business group
The Trump Campaign, his election group
evidence: Charges against the Trump Organization, and one of its top executives, are related to alleged tax crimes tied to an inquiry into employee perks such as rent-free homes, car leases and bonuses.

question_sentence: Rescuers are still sifting through debris at the site of the Miami-area condo collapse. So far, at least 20 people have been confirmed dead and more than 100 are still unaccounted for. What is slowing down rescue efforts?
evidence: Rescuers are having to contend with oncoming extreme weather and worries about fires and structural instability as they work their way through the 16 feet of debris from the collapse

question_sentence: Donald Rumsfeld died this week at the age of 88. What critical Cabinet position did he hold during George W. Bush’s presidency?
evidence: Rumsfeld was the Secretary of Defense under the Bush Administration from 2001 to 2006. He held the same position during Gerald Ford’s presidency from 1975 to 1977.

question_sentence: Which NFL football team was fined $10 million after an investigation revealed what Commissioner Roger Goodell called a “highly unprofessional” environment?
evidence: The investigation into the Washington Football Team was launched after 15 former female employees and two journalists who covered the team accused team staffers of sexual harassment and verbal abuse

question_sentence: China recently commemorated an important anniversary of what historic event?
choices: the birth of the Chinese Communist Party
evidence: Chinese President Xi Jinping was at the forefront of nationwide celebrations observing the 100th anniversary of the Chinese Communist Party.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court handed down several key decisions this week before the end of its term. One decision has been lauded as a win for LGBTQ rights, because it reinforces the rights of transgender people to do what common thing?
choices: obtain a license with their correct gender identity
use the bathroom that corresponds with their gender identity
use their correct gender identity on school enrollment forms
evidence: The Supreme Court left in place a decision that allowed a transgender student in Virginia to use the bathroom that corresponded to his gender identity.

question_sentence: Rapper Cardi B caused a wave of excitement during her performance at the BET Awards. What did she do?
choices: revealed a series of special guests
evidence: Cardi B revealed her bejeweled baby bump, announcing she is pregnant with her second child.

question_sentence: U.S. News & World Report has released updated rankings of the healthiest communities in the US. In what state is the number 1 healthiest community?
evidence: Los Alamos County, New Mexico, has been ranked the healthiest US community for the second year in a row.

question_sentence: Myanmar’s military junta still holds widespread power over the country following a February coup. Now, a new report reveals they also have a commanding hold on this important national industry.
evidence: Myanmar produces about 70% of the world’s jade, worth billions of dollars, and the junta has such a strong hold that experts say it would be nearly impossible to buy the gem there without enriching the country’s generals and their allies.

question_sentence: Some people are furious that American sprinter Sha’Carri Richardson has been disqualified from the Tokyo Olympics. Why was she disqualified?
choices: she used foul language during a race
her foot crossed a track line during a race
she tested positive for performance-enhancing substances
evidence: Richardson tested positive for marijuana, leading to a one-month suspension that will kick her out of the Tokyo Olympic games. Critics of the decision brought up past conduct by US Olympians that received little punishment, and pointed out marijuana is a legal substance in many parts of the US.
